intro: Syncalathium pilosum, commonly known as the hairy syncalathium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Syncalathium pilosum is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in humid conditions.
